title: Nikki Bella opens up about the Strictly and Dancing with the Stars 'curse'
text:

Wrestling legend Nikki Bella has dished on her relationship with her dancer boyfriend, and the secret behind the Strictly Come Dancing and Dancing with the Stars 'curse'.

The curse refers to the number of dancing couples who end up having long relationships after the show.

The 36 year-old met her current beau, hunky pro dancer Artem Chigvintsev, while doing Dancing with the Stars - the American version of Strictly - back in 2017.

Nikki was to marry fellow wrestler-turned-Hollywood superstar John Cena , but after they called off their engagement two years ago she and Artem got back in touch and struck up a relationship.

(Image: London Entertainment / SplashNews.com)

(Image: London Entertainment / SplashNews.com)

Speaking on The Bellas podcast, which she co-hosts with her twin sister Brie, Nikki dropped a bombshell about why the curse is so powerful.

She revealed: "Artem and I have an amazing sex life.

"When they say dancers are the best, let me tel ya: Once you have a dancer, you don't go back. That's it.

(Image: London Entertainment / SplashNews.com)

"If he leaves me, I'm going to the ballet every night because that's that."

She added: "He just moves those hips, and he'll even do it naked."

"I'm sorry! I have to tell 'em!" she apologised to Artem, before telling that she wants sex regualrly.

"We went two weeks without having sex," Nikki told her sister, "It kind of made me like, angry, like you know how you get hangry? I don't know if they have a name for it for sex...but I get hangry."

(Image: Getty Images)

Mum of one Brie explained that her sex life is quite different.

She said: "You know what mum life is like? A kid making noise, waking you up when you're making out and getting right there."

Nikki laughed: "Well, that's why I'm not a mum, so I can feed my hunger!"

The curse has affected a collection of celebs and dancers on Strictly as well, including last year's champs Stacey Dooley and Kevin Clifton, and Countdown co-host Rachel Riley and her now-husband Pasha Kovalev.

(Image: PA)

Nikki and John Cena called it quits in April 2017 after a six year relationship.

She told Page Six at the time: "One person had to sacrifice their career [for us to be together], but I'm not willing to do that.

"I'm just not the girl who hangs out on set. I have my own career. I want to be one of Forbes' top entrepreneurs."

She also responded to rumours the break-up was faked to help their careers, snapping: "People said it was fake for ratings, don't you think a wedding would be best for ratings?

"I would never fake a break-up.

"And when people keep questioning it, it actually makes your heart ache even more."
description: Nikki told all on an episode of her podcast about her dancer boyfriend, who she met while doing Dancing with the Stars
